intro: Adelmeria dicranochila, commonly known as the silverleaf huckleberry, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of southern California and northern Baja California, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces clusters of white to pinkish flowers in the spring, which are followed by small, edible berries. Adelmeria dicranochila is an important plant for local wildlife, providing food for birds and mammals.
